title: revert the ranked changes for a rank in each role
body: its terrible it sounds good but the way you went about it is god awful half the champions you can top can go mid lane like ryze so i could be a diamond top laner playing the same champion and in mid lane it will say your plat 3 and on top of that you have to do a ranked provisional on each role to move up a rank the splash is trash you get 30lp splashes 3 lp and your skill carries over into other roles

No
Champs you're not familiar with and wanna learn have no place in ranked. It's competetive, not your practice mode.
If you enjoy playing multiple lanes/champs on different ranks then I'm glad you like it, just not ones that are new to you.
I practiced Taliyah for half an hour in Practice Tool in Bronze III, went straight to Ranked, won my first game and was Silver by the end of the season.

Congrats, I played a normal game with Cait after not playing her for a while, won and went on for a 8 win streak in ranked.
Ofc you can do well with champs you don't play as much. But such examples don't really matter, compared to the majority. If you're not familiar with your champ, you're effectively putting your team at a disadvantage.

Every champ you play in Ranked, you play for the first time in Ranked at some point.  Whether that’s after a bunch of Normal games or not, it’s true, and requiring players to have Mastery etc. would just slow down the meta.

I'm not talking about first time playing ranked. I'm talking about playing ranked and picking a champion you haven't played before, regardless of ranked or normal. You are putting your team at a disadvantage because you don't have any experience with them, period.
I’d never played Taliyah outside the Practice Tool and won the game.
Again, one example out of many is no evidence.
You made a categorical statement.  Also, at higher elo, the meta shift often requires players to shift champs suddenly.  If Zilean becomes meta, then, well, it’s time for Zilean, boys!

Alright then, explain to me why most new released champs or vgu's have a low winrate in the first days after their release. Because people don't know how to play them right away. If you bring them into ranked, you put your team at a disadvantage.
Meta is also something different again. Stronger champs tend to have it easier to win because of whatever reasons. In this case I can see that no knowledge of the champ might not have that much of an influence. However, metaslaves also lose with champs they think they can easily win with, just because they're strong, but end up losing and dragging down the overall winrate.

Plenty of people just try them out, too.  Not everyone in Ranked, if you can believe it, is someone who’s playing every game for the win.  That means sitting down, looking back on past games, recognizing mistakes, watching pro streams, and reading about how to improve.  Some people just want to play a competitive game.

This is so much better than last season when you could have random autofill games count fully against your main mmr.

Other roles rubberband to your primary role and should be factored into your placements as well.

Playing mid and top is also very different, so sharing a champion pool only gives you so many gains.

The ranked change is in beta, so I would change the title/desire from 'just get rid of the system entirely' to 'increase initial splash' (as they should change on win/loss sprees and if the system thinks you might be soft-inting in your off-roles).
